title: Comparative in silico analysis of mce operons across Mycobacteriaceae and Nocardiaceae: Insights into genetic arrangements and regulatory mechanisms.
abstract: The mammalian cell entry (Mce) proteins are critical for the entry and persistence of Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) within alveolar macrophages. These proteins assemble into an ATP-binding cassette transporter comprising six substrate-binding proteins (MceA-F), two transmembrane domains (YrbEAB), and two nucleotide-binding domains (MceG
